Pre-Game Insights: Ghana may have struggled in their opening two matches, but the quality within their squad is undeniable, and this could prove too much to handle for Sudan, who have historically struggled as visitors in this fixture.
Ghana are unbeaten at home against Sudan, recording four wins and a draw in five such games.
Others: Ghana's team news includes the withdrawal of Thomas Partey, Joseph Paintsil, Kingsley Schindler, and Osman Ibrahim due to injuries.
Sudan's team news includes the return of Eid Moghaddam and Al-Merreikh goalkeeper Ahmed Peter to the team.
Ghana's possible starting lineup includes Ati-Zigi, Seidu, Salisu, Mumin, Lamptey, Samed, Ashimeru, Fatawu, Kudus, Semenyo, and Ayew.
Sudan's possible starting lineup includes Abou, Agab, Koko, Karshoum, Khamis, Abuaagla, Khidir, Eisa, Omer, Thierry, and Abdelrahman.
